titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Cellulose, Paper and Textile Division records 1919-1985
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Cellulose, Paper and Textile Division records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Cellulose, Paper and Textile Division (CELL) was a technical division within the ACS focused on the identification, processing, and dissemination of knowledge related to the science and technology of renewable materials and biopolymers. (In 2001, it was renamed the Cellulose and Renewable Materials Division.)

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the ACS Cellulose, Paper and Textile Division. Materials include: administrative records (1919-1975); correspondence and Executive Committee minutes (1970-1984); copies of the Fibril Angle newsletters; correspondence, programs, and addresses from the annual Anselme Payen Awards; division histories and photographs; annual programs, abstracts and technical reports from National Meetings (1944-1984, some years missing); and a small number of financial records.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
